CADI.Common.Core

Class PrefSemaphore

  • java.lang.Object
    • CADI.Common.Core.PrefSemaphore
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProxyPrefSemaphore

    public class PrefSemaphore
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a semaphore used to control when threads that are attending to client requests are busy. Therefore, while, at least, one thread is attending to a client, the proxy prefetching must be sleeping, and it will only be awaken when there not exist any client's request waiting.

    The semaphore can be started or stopped by means of the setOn() and setOff() methods, respectively. They set the trigger attribute.

    Moreover, it records the number of locks performed between two consecutive calls to the waitChanges() method. This functionality is useful to control that threads attending to clients perhaps a new woi has been added to the history, then the woi to be prefetched should be recomputed.

    Usage example in threads that attend clients:
    lock
    unlock

    Usage example in the prefetching thread:
    waitChanges
    await
    changes

    Version:
    1.0.0 2011/10/23
    Author:
    Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)
